Definition: In this task, you're given five sentences, numbered 1 through 5. Your job is to generate a title for the story that makes complete sense. The title must be short, with less than three words, use simple language, and include the main topic of the story.

Positive Examples.input: Sentence 1: Marcus needed clothing for a business casual event. Sentence 2: All of his clothes were either too formal or too casual. Sentence 3: He decided to buy a pair of khakis. Sentence 4: The pair he bought fit him perfectly. Sentence 5: Marcus was happy to have the right clothes for the event.
Positive Examples.explanation: Marcus's reasons for buying khakis is established, followed by his purchase of them and reaction.

Positive Examples.explanation: Laura was planning to plant corn, realized the infeasibility of the idea, and then decided against it.

Positive Examples.input: Sentence 1: Ben found a frog in the creek. Sentence 2: It was green and slimy. Sentence 3: He took it home and put it in a bucket. Sentence 4: The next day, the frog was gone. Sentence 5: He'd jumped out and escaped!

Negative Examples.input: Sentence 1: My grandparents and I were going for a walk. Sentence 2: Suddenly, right in front of us, was a huge moose. Sentence 3: We were walking near some pine trees and turned a corner. Sentence 4: It was so close that it scared us, but they told me not to run. Sentence 5: We all stood still and soon the moose walked away without harm.
Negative Examples.explanation: The people saw a moose, stopped walking, and allowed it to pass. The title is therefore incorrect.

Negative Examples.input: Sentence 1: Mary sliced the purple eggplant. Sentence 2: Then she breaded each slice carefully before frying them. Sentence 3: She layered each breaded slice into her casserole dish. Sentence 4: Finally, she sprinkled parmesan cheese on top and baked it. Sentence 5: She poured homemade marinara sauce in the dish.
Negative Examples.explanation: The story describes how eggplant parmesan is made step by step. The title is therefore incorrect.

Sentence 1: During the twelfth grade all the guys planned a party. Sentence 2: We agreed to wear suites. Sentence 3: My cousin and i went to pick up a classmate. Sentence 4: We got stuck in mud on a dirt road. Sentence 5: The spend of the car tossed mud all over my cousin's suit.

Sentence 1: Tom was feeling a bit down. Sentence 2: He thought a shopping trip would cheer him up. Sentence 3: Tom got himself several new items. Sentence 4: Unfortunately they didn't make him happier. Sentence 5: Tom kept shopping to see if it would help.

Sentence 1: I like going to minor league baseball games. Sentence 2: This Wednesday my son took me to a Single A baseball game. Sentence 3: I bought a bat and a cap. Sentence 4: My wife got me three programs. Sentence 5: It was an exciting night.

Sentence 1: Jane worked as a teller at a grocery store. Sentence 2: Every now and then she would get weird money. Sentence 3: Money she thought might be fake. Sentence 4: One time a customer paid with fresh new twenties. Sentence 5: They all wound up being fake.

Sentence 1: Sarah really likes to take care of succulents. Sentence 2: She thinks they're adorable little plants. Sentence 3: While shopping, she found a neglected little succulent. Sentence 4: She decided to buy the plant and bring it home to nurse it. Sentence 5: Now the plant is doing really well and has several young sprouts.

Sentence 1: Ed was bowling with his friends. Sentence 2: He was a good bowler and his friends knew it. Sentence 3: He grabbed a ball and prepped for his throw. Sentence 4: He swung back hard and threw it towards the pins. Sentence 5: It slammed into the gutter and everyone laughed.

Sentence 1: I made a 23. Sentence 2: That was a point higher than my first time. Sentence 3: I had a little more energy when I went in the second time. Sentence 4: I was able to answer more of the questions. Sentence 5: I thought I could go higher than a 22.

Sentence 1: David ordered chicken nuggets at a fast food restaurant. Sentence 2: He took a seat at an empty table. Sentence 3: He opened up his food. Sentence 4: There was a piece of gum in one of the chicken nuggets. Sentence 5: The cashier refunded his order.

Sentence 1: Liza managed a diner. Sentence 2: Two of her workers called in sick. Sentence 3: It was busy at the diner. Sentence 4: Liza had several applications on her desk. Sentence 5: She called one of the applicants to see if she could start working.

Sentence 1: Lacy was a member of her school's marching band. Sentence 2: The band's performance called for a solo. Sentence 3: Lacy practiced the solo part every day. Sentence 4: She tried out to get the solo in the band. Sentence 5: Lacy was chosen to do the solo in the performance.

Sentence 1: Today Anne learned how to brush her teeth by herself. Sentence 2: She went in big circles all around. Sentence 3: She was so excited. Sentence 4: Her parents went out that night so she could try it on her own. Sentence 5: She was glad she had the new found independence.

Sentence 1: Priya was the best speller in her class. Sentence 2: Her teacher decided to enter her in a spelling bee. Sentence 3: Priya won the first spelling bee. Sentence 4: She then advanced to the state level. Sentence 5: She won it as well and went to nationals.

Sentence 1: Ned has some mud on his feet from playing outside today. Sentence 2: He decides to clean his feet. Sentence 3: Ned gives both of his feet a thorough washing. Sentence 4: He feels much better afterwards. Sentence 5: Ned is happy he doesn't have muddy feet any longer.

Sentence 1: I used to use a lawn service to fertilize my grass. Sentence 2: After 2 years, I was still getting weeds and clover. Sentence 3: I figured out how much I had paid the service over the years. Sentence 4: It really was cheaper to fertilize my own lawn. Sentence 5: My lawn looks a lot better now.

Sentence 1: Greg liked being outside. Sentence 2: He went to a local park to sit in the grass. Sentence 3: He watched the people go by. Sentence 4: He also watched the cute dogs being walked. Sentence 5: Greg was happiest when he was outdoors.

Sentence 1: My daughter is pregnant with her second child. Sentence 2: She wanted to announce it on FB. Sentence 3: She bought a big sister book. Sentence 4: She took a photo of her first child reading it. Sentence 5: She posted the photo on FB.

Sentence 1: Little Megan loves her teddy bear. Sentence 2: One day she woke up and it was missing. Sentence 3: She looked all over and couldn't find the bear anywhere. Sentence 4: Her mom came in and asked why she was crying and megan told her. Sentence 5: Her mother found the bear and Megan wasn't sad anymore.

Sentence 1: After I got off from work, I went to vote at my assigned location. Sentence 2: I had already registered to vote a month ago. Sentence 3: I got to the front of the line, and was told I could not vote. Sentence 4: Apparently, someone had altered my party affiliation. Sentence 5: I left the voting location, confused and upset.

Sentence 1: Tim moved into a new apartment. Sentence 2: It was a brand new building. Sentence 3: Tim paid a lot of money for rent. Sentence 4: Within the first month several things broke. Sentence 5: The new apartment was poorly made.

Sentence 1: Jonathan yelled into the mountains. Sentence 2: He heard his echo yell back. Sentence 3: Then he heard a loud roar. Sentence 4: Jonathan knew there weren't any animals that road in Alaska. Sentence 5: He wondered if it was Big Foot and ran away.

Sentence 1: Mindy worked in an office. Sentence 2: She was responsible for making the coffee in the morning. Sentence 3: Mindy noticed that the coffee was running low. Sentence 4: She bought some coffee on her way to the office. Sentence 5: The office reimbursed her purchase.

Sentence 1: I was eating out with my family. Sentence 2: I decided to get the BBQ. Sentence 3: When it arrive, the BBQ was dripping in sauce. Sentence 4: I could only take a few bites without using napkins. Sentence 5: I ended up using at least fifty napkins.

Sentence 1: The class had to share a box of crayons. Sentence 2: Nancy took the entire box when she was drawing. Sentence 3: Cindy tried to get a few pieces from Nancy. Sentence 4: However, she brushed Cindy off when she asked. Sentence 5: Cindy started to cry afterwards.

Sentence 1: I hated watching Star Trek. Sentence 2: My brother watched it every day. Sentence 3: I got really sick of the shows. Sentence 4: I started calling it Star Wreck. Sentence 5: I stopped after he yelled at me about it.

Sentence 1: Andrew was a storm chaser for a major network. Sentence 2: He and his crew were sent to the midwest to track some bad weather. Sentence 3: After driving all through the night, they made it. Sentence 4: They drove around looks for storm clouds the next day. Sentence 5: Just when they had given up, a tornado formed 100 yards away from them.

Sentence 1: Nina had an essay to write for chemistry. Sentence 2: At first she had no idea what topic to pick. Sentence 3: Then she thought of her best friend Adam, and got inspired. Sentence 4: She wrote a paper on the subject of atoms! Sentence 5: Nina's essay scored an A!

Sentence 1: Jennifer had physical therapy appointment at her doctor's office. Sentence 2: She arrived early so she sat down and waited to be called to the back. Sentence 3: She noticed her appointment time passed and no one called her name. Sentence 4: Her physical therapist assistant saw her sitting in the waiting area. Sentence 5: Jennifer was reminded her appointment was tomorrow.

Sentence 1: Joe was going hiking in the morning. Sentence 2: So Joe slept early. Sentence 3: Joe then woke up early and got ready and packed his gear. Sentence 4: Joe got in his car and drove towards hiking trail. Sentence 5: Joe hiked two miles then left home.

Sentence 1: Terry had bought he and his sister these basketball tickets long ago. Sentence 2: It was surprise for his sister's birthday and she knew ad no idea. Sentence 3: When he picked her up and she was happy when she saw the tickets. Sentence 4: When they got to their seats she hugged him and said thank you. Sentence 5: Their favorite basketball team ended up winning which made them happy.

Sentence 1: Today I took my motor scooter to the gas station to fill it with gas. Sentence 2: Once it was filled, I tried to start it. Sentence 3: It would not start! Sentence 4: The man at the station gave me some oil to put in it. Sentence 5: After it was filled, it started right up!

Sentence 1: Isaac got a camera for his birthday. Sentence 2: And he was completely obsessed with it. Sentence 3: Everyday he went outside to take pictures. Sentence 4: And he eventually took photography courses in college. Sentence 5: Isaac was happy when he finally became a professional photographer.

Sentence 1: I grilled some steaks for my friends the other day. Sentence 2: I bought some real nice cuts from the store. Sentence 3: I spent all day grilling them. Sentence 4: I forgot to take them off the grill. Sentence 5: I burned all the steaks!

Sentence 1: Gary could throw the ball. Sentence 2: He saw the play was different. Sentence 3: He decided to give it to another player. Sentence 4: The player ran really fast. Sentence 5: They scored the touchdown.

Sentence 1: Lucy was fascinated by old abandoned buildings. Sentence 2: The house across the street from her had an abandoned carriage house. Sentence 3: She was very curious and decided to go check it out. Sentence 4: Unfortunately, the floor gave out underneath her and she was injured. Sentence 5: Lucy is still interested in old buildings, but now she is more careful.

Sentence 1: China was browsing the fresh food section of the market. Sentence 2: She strolled passed the assorted colors of vegetables and fruit. Sentence 3: Everything looked so delicious to her. Sentence 4: China picked up a few greens and a melon. Sentence 5: Then, she headed for the check-out.

Sentence 1: I got my drivers license today. Sentence 2: My first trip was to the grocery. Sentence 3: A fellow driver did not use his blinker and ran into me. Sentence 4: I called the police and filed a report. Sentence 5: The other driver had to pay for the damages.

Sentence 1: The old house sat empty on the top of the hill. Sentence 2: Claire walked by it every day after school. Sentence 3: This time she paused at the gate and looked up at the house. Sentence 4: She thought she saw movement in one of the top windows. Sentence 5: Claire hurried home and did not sleep well that night.

Sentence 1: We used to go to the lake every year when I was young. Sentence 2: We rented a cottage there for a week. Sentence 3: My brother and sisters and I would swim and fish and play. Sentence 4: We made lots of friends, too. Sentence 5: We were glad to have a chance to go to the lake.

Sentence 1: Kaya rented the boat named for her, the kayak. Sentence 2: She thought she'd be a natural. Sentence 3: But she wasn't! Sentence 4: In ten minutes she had flipped the kayak. Sentence 5: Rescue crews had to come help Kaya!

Sentence 1: Tom was playing cards with other guys in his college dorm. Sentence 2: During the game, Tom made a rude crack about truck drivers. Sentence 3: Tom wound up feeling just terrible about this. Sentence 4: One of the other guys took Tom aside. Sentence 5: The guy told Tom that his dad was a lifelong truck driver!
